meanings.definition: A propulsion system that allows a spacecraft to travel faster than the speed of light.
meanings.sent1: The spaceship's hyperdrive enabled it to zoom through space at incredible speeds.
meanings.sent2: The crew relied on the hyperdrive to reach distant galaxies in record time.
meanings.sent3: When the hyperdrive malfunctioned, the spaceship ended up in a different universe!
meanings.sent4: Her imagination was like a hyperdrive, propelling her stories into uncharted territories.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's explanation of the hyperdrive was as clear as a bright star in the night sky.

meanings.definition: To engage or activate a hyperdrive system.
meanings.sent1: Captain, prepare to hyperdrive us out of here!
meanings.sent2: The pilot quickly hyperdrove the ship to escape the approaching asteroid field.
meanings.sent3: The chef hyperdrove around the kitchen, preparing dishes at lightning speed.
meanings.sent4: Her determination hyperdrove her to finish the race despite the obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The music hyperdrove the crowd into a frenzy, with everyone dancing joyfully.

meanings.definition: The technology or mechanism used for faster-than-light travel.
meanings.sent1: Scientists are still studying the hyperdrive to unlock its full potential.
meanings.sent2: The blueprint detailed the intricate workings of the hyperdrive system.
meanings.sent3: The hyperdrive was the star of the spaceship show, captivating all who saw it.
meanings.sent4: In her dreams, the hyperdrive was a magical key to exploring the universe.
meanings.sent5: The hyperdrive hummed softly, ready to propel the spacecraft into the unknown.
